items.title: Service Now Live
items.detail:
ServiceNow is an online portal that went live in early December 2016. It contributes to the Department's digital enablement and was built to enable staff to interact more easily with key areas across PM&C such as IT, HR, Communications, Facilities, IA Grants Administration, and Security. Staff can access the information they need and lodge requests and issues directly with the relevant area. Unlike systems in the past, ServiceNow allows everyone to log their job and receive their reference number immediately. The user can then add their own comments to the job and track how the task is progressing.

 

To learn more about ShareHub click here

items.title: Live Briefing System
items.detail:
​The Live Briefing System makes it easy to keep briefs up to date and to work together with your team, across the Department and with the Prime Minister's Office (PMO).

It is a browser app, so it works on all PM&C devices (desktop, laptop, iPad and iPhone) - you can access it at Live Issues Briefs

The technology that supports the Live Briefing system has been re-used to establish 66 other briefing, tracking and information packs.

It builds upon the Department's success in 2016 in delivering the Incoming Government Brief to the Prime Minister in digital format for the very first time.

For more about the Live Briefing System click here

items.title: Cabnet Redevelopment Phase 1
items.detail: ​Under construction - come back later

items.title: Working Your Way
items.detail:
Working Your Way is a workplace project that seeks to transform the way we work. Supported by intensive change management, we'll be creating physical and virtual environments to enhance collaboration and support a flexible and agile workforce that can adapt and respond to the demands of government.​ Its focus is on the National Offices in Canberra but elements of the project are being delivered in the Regional Network as office refits occur. Adelaide, Brisbane and Alice Springs have been recent beneficiaries.

Click here for Working Your Way​

 

Supports the following recommendations/focus areas:
Cultural Audit:
Systems & Structures > Flexible Work Practices
2016 State of the Service:
Innovation / Internal communication / Satisfaction / Efficiency / Change management

items.title: Working Your Way Centraplaza Stage 1
items.detail:
​Centraplaza Stage 1 covers the Ground Floor and Level 2. The Ground Floor will be transformed into a more interactive meeting space that will reflect the Indigenous cultures that we represent and work for. Level 2 will be a new home for Programme, Integrity and Engagement Division and Community and Economic Development Division. 

For more information of progress and the journey ahead click here​​​

items.title: Working Your Way Centraplaza Stage 2
items.detail:
​​Centraplaza Stage 2 covers Levels 3 and 4. Level 3 will be a new home for Housing, Land and  Culture Division, Indigenous Employment and Recognition Division and corporate enabling functions. Level 3 will be occupied just before Christmas. Level 4 will be a new home for Education, Community Safety and Health Division and corporate enabling functions. Level 4 will be ready late April 2018. 

For more information on progress and the journey ahead click here​​​

To learn more about Working Your Way click here

items.title: Working Your Way ONC Stage 1
items.detail:
​Stage 1 of works in One National Circuit will target the Ground Floor and Level 1. Completing these works, along with the works at Centraplaza, will allow us to relinquish the lease on Lovett Tower.
We are still working out the details for Working Your Way in ONC so this Stage is literally 'under construction'!

Stay up to date with the latest news on progress here

items.title: ShareHub
items.detail:
​ShareHub is the Department's digital workspace. It replaces existing shared drives and paper files, and moves PM&C toward compliance with the National Archives of Australia Digital Transition Policy and its Digital Continuity 2020 Policy.

ShareHub is essential to our productivity in this dynamic, digital, connected world and will enable us to meet our government accountability requirements.

To learn more about ShareHub click here

To see what's coming in April with ShareHub Release 2.0 click here

items.title: Sharehub Release 2.0
items.detail:
​ShareHub Release 2.0 will occur on 22 April 2017. It will deliver an new look in line with the Department's corporate branding and added functionality like notifications.

 

Check out the changes to come in Release 2.0 here

items.title: Cultural Audit release
items.detail:
​In 2016, the Department engaged The May Group to conduct a cultural audit to determine barriers to inclusion and identify strategies to create an inclusive organisational culture that provides equal opportunity for all staff. The audit incorporated the views of 1,051 staff.
The PM&C Cultural Audit was released to the Department on 21 October 2016.

To access the PM&C Cultural Audit click here

Supports the following recommendations/focus areas:
2016 State of the Service:
Commitment and loyalty / Career progression / Diversity / Innovation / Job-skills match / Learning and development / Open consultation / Recognition and feeling valued / Recruitment and selection

items.title: New Workforce Strategy
items.detail: ​​

items.title: Gender Equality Action Plan
items.detail:
PM&C is committed to embracing diversity, and drawing on the skills and potential of all employees. While PM&C has strong representation by women at all levels, areas for improvement in women's experience in the workplace remain. 

In response to the actions set out within Balancing the Future: The APS Gender Equality Strategy 2016-2019, People Branch has drafted the Gender Equality Action Plan. The draft Gender Equality Action Plan went up on the Have Your Say platform in February 2017 for a two week consultation period. It will be launched on the intranet by 28 April 2017.

The PM&C Gender Equality Action Plan aims to drive cultural change across six domains:

  • Recruitment, Retention and Promotion
  • Driving a supportive and enabling culture
  • Gender equality in APS leadership
  • Innovation to embed equality in employment practices
  • Increased uptake of flexible work by men
  • Measurement and evaluation

Check out the APS Gender Equality Strategy 2016-2019 here

Supports the following recommendations/focus areas:
Cultural Audit:
Leadership & Accountability > Diversity targets and goals
Awareness & Capability Development
Systems & Structures > Recruitment & promotions
Systems & Structures > Talent management
Systems & Structures > Flexible work practices 
2016 State of the Service:
Innovation / Internal communication / Satisfaction / Efficiency / Change management

items.title: SES Talent Management
items.detail:
​The Department's SES cohort are trialling a new and more sophisticated approach to performance and remuneration management this reporting cycle. Adapting the APSC's APS nine-box grid, the PM&C model places a greater focus within each box on behaviours and suggested development opportunities . The direct link with the current five point rating scale has been removed to provide greater flexibility and enable a more accurate assessment against the model.

To learn more about the APS nine-box grid click here

Supports the following recommendations/focus areas:
Cultural Audit:
Leadership & Accountability
Awareness & Capability Development
Systems & Structures > Talent management
2016 State of the Service: 
Senior leadership / Workplace culture / Health,safety and well being / Innovation / Performance feedback / Remuneration and conditions

items.title: SES Culture Change Workshops
items.detail: ​These workshops will shape the collective leadership efforts to drive and embed a more inclusive and diverse PM&C.

items.title: Launch Program
items.detail:
​The Launch is an opportunity for:

• The Executive Board to affirm their personal commitment to building a more diverse and inclusive workplace;

• Members of PM&C's different diversity networks to talk about their priorities and actions in support of an inclusive and diverse workplace;

• David Gruen, Anne-Marie Roberts and Simon Duggan to reflect the feedback received through their consultations and to take staff through the proposed work program.

items.title: Workplace Evaluation Data Published
items.detail:
PM&C's workplace evaluation data to be published will include our standing in relation to:

- Gender Equality
- LGBTI inclusiveness
- Progress toward reconciliation
- Disability inclusiveness
- Cultural and Linguistically diversity

items.title: Embracing Inclusion and Diversity Program
items.detail:
​Embracing Inclusion and Diversity represents the Department’s response to the Cultural Audit conducted in 2016. The purpose of Embracing Inclusion and Diversity is to:

  • Demonstrate links between the Cultural Audit and existing organisational strategies and action plans e.g. the Gender Equality Action Plan 2016-19 and the Reconciliation Action Plan.
  • Enable the Department to broaden accountability and ensure that this work program is embraced as a key departmental priority that is central to the work of all staff and all business areas.

Supports the following recommendations/focus areas:
Cultural Audit:
Leadership & Accountability
Awareness & Capability Development
Systems & Structures > Recruitment & promotions
Systems & Structures > Talent management
Systems & Structures > Flexible work practices 
2016 State of the Service:
Senior leadership / Diversity / Health, safety and well-being / Recognition & feeling valued

items.title: National Policy Lab established
items.detail: ​A new National Policy Lab will be established to bring together the capabilities of The Project Office and the BETA Unit as an APS resource for policy problem solving and evaluation. The National Policy Lab will promote the use of design thinking, agile methodologies and crowd-sourcing in policy work.
